hint.text: Join OB to form a quadrilateral OBCA.

solution.text:
For a quadrilateral \(\angle\)ACB + \(\angle\)CBO + \(\angle\)BOA +\(\angle\)OAC = 360\(^\circ\)
BC and AC are tangents to the circle
\(\Rightarrow\) \(\angle\)CBO = \(\angle\)OAC = 90\(^\circ\)
therefore, \(\angle\)ACB + \(\angle\)BOA = 360\(^\circ\) - 180\(^\circ\)
\(\angle\)ACB=_{{2*j}}_\(^\circ\) (given)
hence, \(\angle\)BOA = 180\(^\circ\)- \(\angle\)ACB
Now in the triangle(OAB), we have sides, OA=OB=radius
\(\Rightarrow\)\(\angle\)OAB=\(\angle\)OBA
For any triangle, \(\angle\)OAB+\(\angle\)OBA+\(\angle\)BOA=180\(^\circ\)
Putting \(\angle\)OBA=\(\angle\)OAB and \(\angle\)BOA =180\(^\circ\)-\(\angle\)ACB in the above equation
we get 2\(\times\)\(\angle\)OAB=180\(^\circ\)- 180\(^\circ\)+\(\angle\)ACB= \(\angle\)ACB
\(\Rightarrow\) \(\angle\)OAB=\(\frac {\angle ACB}2=\frac {_{{2*j}}_}2=_{j}_^\circ\)

content.text:
In the given figure, two tangents are drawn from the point C
If \(\angle\) ACB=_{{2*j}}_\(^\circ\), find the value of \(\angle\) OAB
